Su.Action: Listens intently to a suspicious phone call, reacts quickly by cursing and taking off, showing alertness and decisiveness.
Easily gains access to a difficult location (roof of an apartment building) and performs a dangerous, skillful descent by grabbing multiple balcony rails and vaulting onto a balcony.
Slaps Christophe multiple times to get information about the stones.
Confronts Christophe confidently and physically over the stones, using a precise and effective slap to assert control.
Demands information directly and maintains composure despite Christophe's hostility.
Does not take action or intervene during the unfolding situation; remains unmentioned and inactive in a moment requiring decisiveness.
Warns Fait about betrayal and police arrival while speeding through the city, showing awareness and urgency.
Studies a computer map of downtown while driving, indicating multitasking and situational awareness.
Fights Miles to retrieve the jewels, ensuring Miles has no more.
Intercepts and subdues Miles quickly and effectively in a dangerous environment, ensuring possession of the jewels.
Throws the bag down, cursing in Chinese after not finding what he wants.
Sifts through the bag of jewels, becomes agitated when what he wants isn't there, then throws the bag down and curses.
Steps off the elevator carrying the bag of jewels and confidently approaches a police officer, flashing ID and asking who is in charge.
Calmly states 'Looks dead to me' upon seeing Christophe stuffed in the fish tank.
Engages in a tense negotiation with Fait, offering a way out but showing no empathy or friendliness.
Introduces himself simply and directly without pretense.
Calmly reveals presence and states facts without hesitation, indicating confidence.
Negotiates with Fait by offering a way out, showing strategic thinking.
Does not engage in physical fight despite provocation, indicating restraint and confidence in other means.
Throws a bottle to disarm a thug and joins the fight to protect Fait.
Throws a bottle to disarm an opponent, intervening decisively to help Fait.
Engages in a two-on-two fight using all available means, showing skill and resilience.
Kicks one dog flying and whip-kicks another off Fait, effectively defending against unexpected threats.
Leads Fait to an abandoned car to evade attack dogs, acts decisively to trap the dogs inside the car by shutting doors quickly, ensuring their safety.
Spots an abandoned car with an open door and directs Fait to it, showing situational awareness.
Executes a complex escape maneuver: dives through the car door, somersaults over the seat, kicks open the far door, rolls out, and shuts the doors to trap the dogs inside.
Acts quickly and decisively under pressure, effectively trapping the attacking dogs and ensuring their escape.
Questions Archie about calling the police, showing awareness of the situation's practicalities.
Shows official I.D. when asked, demonstrating preparedness and confidence.
Does not intervene or offer a solution when Archie surrenders and provides little useful information.
Firmly demands the release of the kidnapped girl, refusing to negotiate despite threats.
Firmly states that the stones belong to their government and takes the phone to negotiate directly in Chinese, refusing to negotiate and demanding the girl be released.
Refuses to negotiate for the girl, insists on having the stones only.
Explains to Fait that refusing to negotiate will confuse the enemy and buy time to keep the girl alive.
Proposes working together with Fait to get both the stones and the daughter back.
Refuses to negotiate and hangs up the phone to confuse the opponent and buy time to keep the girl alive.
Clearly states his position and plans to work together with Fait to get both the stones and the daughter back, showing strategic thinking and confidence.
Expresses sympathy to Fait about his daughter and shares about her own daughter.
Provides important information about the stones and the man holding Vanessa.
Recognizes that the stones are not what they seem and informs Fait, showing insight and awareness.
Expresses empathy toward Fait about his daughter, indicating emotional intelligence but not directly related to competence.
Engages in conversation to gather and share critical information about the situation and the antagonist.
Does not intervene or take direct action when Vanessa is captured and screaming in the camper.
Complies with prison rules by removing shoes without argument, showing awareness and respect for environment.
Stays silent during tense negotiation, allowing Fait to lead conversation with Chambers.
Stops Fait from attacking Chickens, catches the blade with fingers, preventing violence.
Engages in pragmatic conversation with Fait, showing no emotional warmth but practical focus.
Catches a prison shank blade with thumb and forefinger, holding it firmly to prevent the attacker from pushing or pulling.
Engages in a strategic discussion with Fait about locating the stones and planning their next move.
Admits to not having the same intuitive 'feeling' about the location of the stones as Fait does.
Questions the reliability of Archie's memory and considers the possibility that he might not remember important information.
Engages in a plan to 'pretend it's Taiwan' to make Archie remember, showing strategic thinking.
No direct actions or statements by Su in this excerpt; no evidence of competence or incompetence.
Asks relevant, clarifying questions about the boxing matches and the plan to find the man, showing attention to detail and cautiousness.
Does not display direct action or decision-making in the excerpt; mostly listens and asks questions.
Expresses surprise at Archie's boastful and aggressive talk to the guard.
Clarifies that he did not come to fight, indicating honesty and straightforwardness.
Questions Archie's plan and expresses surprise at being entered into a fight without his consent.
Follows Archie through a crowded, chaotic environment without apparent hesitation or confusion.
Relies on Archie to handle the interaction with the guard and entry into the fight club rather than taking initiative himself.
Confidently states 'I'll handle it' when asked about dealing with the man with the diamond pinkie-ring.
Remains silent when asked about the stones, showing restraint or strategic withholding of information.
Waves off the Bruiser's challenge and refuses to fight despite pressure from the crowd and Archie.
Fights by dodging and not engaging aggressively, showing restraint and respect by bowing to his opponent after losing.
Dodges opponent's attacks skillfully, using evasive tactics to buy time.
Acknowledges defeat gracefully by bowing and leaving the fight when hit and the crowd is against him.
Does not aggressively fight back or try to win the match, effectively losing on purpose.
Moves the midget Ring Announcer aside despite resistance and forces back by multiple fighters, then gets back into the cage to face them all.
Uses all his own skills and whatever's at hand during the fight against multiple opponents.
Engineers it so one opponent turns on another opponent.
Wields the midget like a fighting staff.
Starts reducing the opposition one by one.
Skillfully subdues the kick boxer by tying him up in his own clothes, demonstrating physical capability and quick thinking.
Looks for Archie and the man with the ring but cannot find them immediately, then hurries out of the cage, showing situational awareness but some lack of information.
Runs into the parking area and quickly locates Archie and the man with the ring, showing promptness and focus.
Asks Archie where the man went, relying on Archie for information rather than taking independent action.
Identifies that something isn't right about the situation and suspects the doorman.
Moves cautiously with Fait to investigate Chambers' office and opens the door after a silent 'ready-ready' look, showing readiness and confidence.
Keeps calm and focused while searching the fountain despite the grim situation.
Refuses to entertain Fait's hope of Vanessa being spared, showing a lack of empathy or compassion.
Encourages Fait to move on and keep going despite the loss, showing practical support.
Quickly searches the Zen fountain for the stones, finds one black stone despite the difficult situation.
Confidently identifies Ling as the one who took the stones without hesitation.
Does not engage in futile argument with Fait about Vanessa's fate, instead focuses on moving forward.
Fails to prevent the loss of most stones and Vanessa, indicating a failure in prior planning or protection.
Speaks into a cell phone in Chinese to a superior, admits losing the stones and not knowing Ling's location, expresses inability to find him.
Quickly ends the phone call to his superior to focus on the urgent situation with Vanessa.
Speaks in Chinese to his superior, indicating prioritization of the current crisis over other matters.
Quickly ends the phone call to his superior to focus on the urgent situation.
Asks relevant questions about the brightness of the green light to gather useful information.
Shares critical information about the illegal sale and thinks strategically about how to locate the buyers, showing concern for the group's mission and safety.

Identifies the location and timing of the illegal sale, understands the use of a dye laser to activate the stones, and logically deduces the need to access flight plans to track buyers' arrivals and departures.
Takes a moment to consider how the buyers will operate, showing strategic thinking about their need for privacy and quick access.
Blocks Sona's attacks to protect Ling and signals Tommy and Archie not to let Ling get away.
Faces Sona directly when cornered instead of fleeing, showing resolve and protecting others.
Blocks Sona's counters easily and knocks her back while keeping focus on Ling.
Dives for cover effectively when Sona fires a burst from a full-auto Scorpion.
Signals Tommy and Archie not to let Ling get away, showing situational awareness and leadership.
Runs out of room to hide and ultimately stands to face Sona, accepting the inevitable confrontation.
Runs toward the helicopter, jumps and grabs onto the retractable rear wheel just in time, struggles to hold on as the gear retracts, then lets go to drop safely.
Commands to shoot down the helicopter while hanging on, showing situational awareness and quick decision-making.
Emerges from the fire circle to confront Ling, engages in a brutal fight to the death.
Delivers a painful and torturous final blow to Ling, causing severe injury and suffering.
States 'This is for our friends' before attacking Ling, indicating loyalty and protective intent.
Breaks Ling's hold by quickly identifying a vulnerable position and wrenching Ling's arm until it breaks, then uses the opportunity to retrieve and deploy the ceramic capsule effectively.
Engages in a prolonged, evenly matched fight in a dangerous environment (circle of fire), showing resilience and skill.
Waits patiently for the right moment to strike Ling with the capsule and a precise blow, demonstrating strategic thinking and confidence.
Agrees to help Fait with legal consequences despite being law enforcement.
Successfully uses a high-risk, precise method to kill Ling by releasing a ceramic capsule that flash-cooks him from the inside out, effectively closing a dangerous chapter.
Demonstrates situational awareness and responsibility by deciding the stones will be destroyed to prevent further harm.
Shows leadership and support by acknowledging the legal consequences Fait might face and offering to help.
